awards:
第67届美国导演工会奖(2015)
　　最佳纪录片导演(提名) 丹·克劳斯

　　第86届美国国家评论协会奖(2014)
　　五佳纪录片

　　第30届美国独立精神奖(2015)
　　“比虚构更真实”奖(纪录片) 丹·克劳斯
introduction: A documentary that unveils the moral tensions that tear at soldiers' psyches through the lens of one highly personal story: Private Adam Winfield was a 21-year-old soldier in Afghanistan when he attempted with the help of his father to alert the military to heinous war crimes his platoon was committing. But Winfield's pleas went unheeded. Left on his own and with threats to his life, Private Winfield was himself drawn into the moral abyss, forced to make a split-second decision that would change his life forever.
